boat.name: Aurora
boat.full_description: The second owners have sailed her since 2012. Being a trailer sailer, they have been able to visit a number of different sailing areas in the UK, as well as spending a summer in the Baltic. The Cape Cutter 19 was designed by Dudley Dix to be the maximum size that two hulls could be shipped within a standard 40' shipping container from its original construction site in Cape Town, South Africa. Later boats were built in Rochdale at Honnor Marine. The Cape Cutter has a bluff bow and a generous cockpit with an outboard in a well. Her lowish coachroof gives her pretty lines, and yet clever internal layout makes full use of the internal volume. They carry a high-peaked mainsail, staysail and either genoa or yankee foresail.
boat.short_description: Aurora is a Cape Cutter 19 built in Rochdale by Bob Brown at Honnor Marine. She is currently based on the Solent.

builderByBuilder.name: Honnor Marine Ltd.
builderByBuilder.notes: Owned by Tim and Apil Altham since 2017, Honnor Marine builds the Original Devon (ex Drascombe) Scaffie, Dabber, Lugger, Longboat, Coaster, Gig and the Tamarisk 19
